content: hey @WG-async-foundations
there may not be much to talk about today
I'm talking with the various team leads to let them know what we're doing next for the vision work
which is what we were talking about last week, no major updates there or anything
there are no new issues to triage
so I'll open it up to ongoing work updates and questions, if there are any

I'm still working on the generator capture issue. We talked some the other day. Liveness seems like the way to go. I was hoping to add a little extra to the existing liveness pass to track what's live across yields that we could use in generator_interior.rs, but unfortunately liveness happens after type checking.

I've made progress with the GloRuWriClu, but at the moment most of it is focused on the rustc dev guide.

We may have someone to play the GRWC lead for The Async Book. He's evaluating existing commitments, but @Tim McNamara has expressed an interest in the role.
I plan to be a mentee in TAB cohort. :)
very nice! :)
nice!

eholk said:

I'm still working on the generator capture issue. We talked some the other day. Liveness seems like the way to go. I was hoping to add a little extra to the existing liveness pass to track what's live across yields that we could use in generator_interior.rs, but unfortunately liveness happens after type checking.

ok, we should discuss more in the other topic
otherwise I think we can wrap up unless anyone has something else
@triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
I'm planning a blog post for Inside Rust over the weekend which will be more descriptive of what GRWC is and how it might work. That might be of interest to some here.
Small question about the vision doc deliverables. Are we at a point where we should start work on those, or are we waiting to finalize more of the vision doc first?
@tmandry Can you point me to where there is a discussion what's next in the vision process?

eholk said:

Small question about the vision doc deliverables. Are we at a point where we should start work on those, or are we waiting to finalize more of the vision doc first?

so the plan is to get owners in place for the various deliverables and then start doing sprints in September
Sounds good, thanks!

Doc Jones said:

tmandry Can you point me to where there is a discussion what's next in the vision process?

I think the best place to start is the roadmap
well
that's if you want a list of things we're working on
the shiny future and user's manual of the future tell you what the shiny future actually looks like
What about Niko's map of many colors?
we were also working on a user narrative before niko went on vacation

Doc Jones said:

What about Niko's map of many colors?

that's sort of evolved into the roadmap, though I still like the diagram for seeing dependencies
that said, it's been hard to "factor". some groups of deliverables have dependencies between them, but individual deliverables within them can make progress in parallel
the deliverable pages (linked to from the roadmap) have a "Requires" section that lists their individual dependencies
I'm thinking we should start calling these "initiatives" instead, to align with lang team naming
it also feels a little less like corp speak :-)
I see that I need to monitor the github pages more. I lost the plot between meetings and steps moving forward.
yeah this was merged in the past couple weeks
Or you could go way off the map and call them play dates. I would love to have play dates at work. :)
maybe :)
Fits with the spirit of CTCFT, especially the Fun Times part.
but I think each of these will be multi-week efforts at least
anyway, is there anything else or should we wrap up?
Fun time(s) works too. Hey! It's time for our fun time - instead of it's time for our meeting. :joy:
@triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
I guess that's redundant at this point :P
thanks all! :wave:
:wave:
